title: Armour (skill)
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

The **Armour** skill improves the effectiveness of your armour and reduces most of the penalties associated with the more cumbersome varieties of body [armour](/Armour "Armour").

## Aptitudes

|                                |                              |                            |                                |                              |                                    |                            |                                  |                          |                                |                                |                          |                          |                          |                            |                              |                                |                                            |                          |                        |                                |                      |                                |                          |                          |                              |                                        |
| ------------------------------ | ---------------------------- | -------------------------- | ------------------------------ | ---------------------------- | ---------------------------------- | -------------------------- | -------------------------------- | ------------------------ | ------------------------------ | ------------------------------ | ------------------------ | ------------------------ | ------------------------ | -------------------------- | ---------------------------- | ------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------ | ------------------------ | ---------------------- | ------------------------------ | -------------------- | ------------------------------ | ------------------------ | ------------------------ | ---------------------------- | -------------------------------------- |
| **[At](/Armataur "Armataur")** | **[Ba](/Barachi "Barachi")** | **[Co](/Coglin "Coglin")** | **[DE](/Deep_Elf "Deep Elf")** | **[Dg](/Demigod "Demigod")** | **[Ds](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn")** | **[Dj](/Djinni "Djinni")** | **[Dr](/Draconian "Draconian")** | **[Fe](/Felid "Felid")** | **[Fo](/Formicid "Formicid")** | **[Gr](/Gargoyle "Gargoyle")** | **[Gh](/Ghoul "Ghoul")** | **[Gn](/Gnoll "Gnoll")** | **[Hu](/Human "Human")** | **[Ko](/Kobold "Kobold")** | **[Mf](/Merfolk "Merfolk")** | **[Mi](/Minotaur "Minotaur")** | **[MD](/Mountain_Dwarf "Mountain Dwarf")** | **[Mu](/Mummy "Mummy")** | **[Na](/Naga "Naga")** | **[Op](/Octopode "Octopode")** | **[On](/Oni "Oni")** | **[Sp](/Spriggan "Spriggan")** | **[Te](/Tengu "Tengu")** | **[Tr](/Troll "Troll")** | **[Vp](/Vampire "Vampire")** | **[VS](/Vine_Stalker "Vine Stalker")** |
| 2                              | 2                            | -1                         | -2                             | -1                           | -1                                 | 0                          | N/A                              | N/A                      | 1                              | 1                              | -1                       | 8                        | 0                        | -2                         | -3                           | 2                              | 1                                          | -2                       | -2                     | N/A                            | -1                   | -3                             | 1                        | -2                       | -2                           | -2                                     |

[Felids](/Felid "Felid"), [Draconians](/Draconian "Draconian") and [Octopodes](/Octopodes "Octopodes") cannot train Armour due to their body restrictions.

## Useful Info

Each level in Armour skill will:

- Give bonus [AC](/AC "AC"), equal to \~4.5% Base AC per level. ("Base AC" is the combined AC of all your armour, excluding AC from their [enchantment](/Enchant "Enchant"))
- Reduce body armour [encumbrance](/Encumbrance "Encumbrance") by \~2.22% per level.

* This reduces the penalties to [evasion](/Evasion "Evasion"), [spellcasting](/Spellcasting "Spellcasting"), and [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons"). Note that body armour also penalizes the [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging") skill directly; this penalty is *not* impacted by Armour skill. Armour skill won't reduce the [stealth](/Stealth "Stealth") penalty, either.

## Strategy

Armour skill provides a percent boost to AC and a percent reduction to encumbrance. Therefore, you don't need a specific amount of Armour skill to wear a given body armour. If you're playing a [Fighter](/Fighter "Fighter"), for instance, you'll want something heavy like [plate armour](/Plate_armour "Plate armour") - whether you have 3 Armour skill or 15 Armour skill.

[Strength](/Strength "Strength") has a big impact when determining what body armour you should wear, arguably more so than Armour skill. As an arbitrary example, say you have 10 strength and are considering [swamp dragon scales](/Swamp_dragon_scales "Swamp dragon scales"). For this specific character, gaining +2 strength would be worth *more* than \~6.92 levels of Armour skill (the exact value also depends on [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging") skill).

In the [early game](/Early_Game_Character_Building "Early Game Character Building"), the impact of the Armour skill is relatively small, so you may want to train offensive skills first.

| [Skills](/Skill "Skill")                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [Weapons](/Weapons "Weapons")                                         | [Short Blades](/Short_Blades "Short Blades") • [Long Blades](/Long_Blades "Long Blades") • [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons")[Axes](/Axes "Axes") • [Maces & Flails](/Maces_%26_Flails "Maces & Flails") • [Polearms](/Polearms "Polearms") • [Staves](/Staves "Staves") • [Unarmed Combat](/Unarmed_Combat "Unarmed Combat") • [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing") |
| Physical                                                              | [Fighting](/Fighting "Fighting") • [Armour]() • [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging") • [Stealth](/Stealth_\(skill\) "Stealth (skill)") • [Shields](/Shields_\(skill\) "Shields (skill)")                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| [Magical](/Magic "Magic")                                             | [Spellcasting](/Spellcasting "Spellcasting") • [Invocations](/Invocations "Invocations") • [Evocations](/Evocations "Evocations") • [Shapeshifting](/Shapeshifting "Shapeshifting")                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| [Spell Schools](/List_of_spells_by_school "List of spells by school") | [Air](/Air "Air") • [Alchemy](/Alchemy "Alchemy") • [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations") • [Earth](/Earth "Earth") • [Fire](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic") • [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes") • [Ice](/Ice_Magic "Ice Magic") • [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy") • [Summoning](/Summoning "Summoning") • [Translocations](/Translocations "Translocations")                      |
html:
Armour (skill)

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

The Armour skill improves the effectiveness of your armour and reduces most of the penalties associated with the more cumbersome varieties of body armour.

Aptitudes

At Ba Co DE Dg Ds Dj Dr Fe Fo Gr Gh Gn Hu Ko Mf Mi MD Mu Na Op On Sp Te Tr Vp VS
2 2 -1 -2 -1 -1 0 N/A N/A 1 1 -1 8 0 -2 -3 2 1 -2 -2 N/A -1 -3 1 -2 -2 -2

Felids, Draconians and Octopodes cannot train Armour due to their body restrictions.

Useful Info

Each level in Armour skill will:

  • Give bonus AC, equal to ~4.5% Base AC per level. ("Base AC" is the combined AC of all your armour, excluding AC from their enchantment)
  • Reduce body armour encumbrance by ~2.22% per level.
This reduces the penalties to evasion, spellcasting, and Ranged Weapons. Note that body armour also penalizes the Dodging skill directly; this penalty is not impacted by Armour skill. Armour skill won't reduce the stealth penalty, either.

Strategy

Armour skill provides a percent boost to AC and a percent reduction to encumbrance. Therefore, you don't need a specific amount of Armour skill to wear a given body armour. If you're playing a Fighter, for instance, you'll want something heavy like plate armour - whether you have 3 Armour skill or 15 Armour skill.

Strength has a big impact when determining what body armour you should wear, arguably more so than Armour skill. As an arbitrary example, say you have 10 strength and are considering swamp dragon scales. For this specific character, gaining +2 strength would be worth more than ~6.92 levels of Armour skill (the exact value also depends on Dodging skill).

In the early game, the impact of the Armour skill is relatively small, so you may want to train offensive skills first.

Skills
Weapons Short Blades • Long Blades • Ranged Weapons

Axes • Maces & Flails • Polearms • Staves • Unarmed Combat • Throwing

Physical Fighting • Armour • Dodging • Stealth • Shields
Magical Spellcasting • Invocations • Evocations • Shapeshifting
Spell Schools Air • Alchemy • Conjurations • Earth • Fire • Hexes • Ice • Necromancy • Summoning • Translocations

{{version031}}

The '''Armour''' skill improves the effectiveness of your armour and reduces most of the penalties associated with the more cumbersome varieties of body [[armour]].

{{skill aptitudes|Armour}}

[[Felid]]s, [[Draconian]]s and [[Octopodes]] cannot train Armour due to their body restrictions.

==Useful Info==
Each level in Armour skill will:
* Give bonus [[AC]], equal to ~4.5% Base AC per level. ("Base AC" is the combined AC of all your armour, excluding AC from their [[enchant]]ment)
* Reduce body armour [[encumbrance]] by ~2.22% per level.
: This reduces the penalties to [[evasion]], [[spellcasting]], and [[Ranged Weapons]]. Note that body armour also penalizes the [[Dodging]] skill directly; this penalty is ''not'' impacted by Armour skill. Armour skill won't reduce the [[stealth]] penalty, either.

==Strategy==
Armour skill provides a percent boost to AC and a percent reduction to encumbrance. Therefore, you don't need a specific amount of Armour skill to wear a given body armour. If you're playing a [[Fighter]], for instance, you'll want something heavy like [[plate armour]] - whether you have 3 Armour skill or 15 Armour skill.

[[Strength]] has a big impact when determining what body armour you should wear, arguably more so than Armour skill. As an arbitrary example, say you have 10 strength and are considering [[swamp dragon scales]]. For this specific character, gaining +2 strength would be worth ''more'' than ~6.92 levels of Armour skill (the exact value also depends on [[Dodging]] skill).

In the [[Early Game Character Building|early game]], the impact of the Armour skill is relatively small, so you may want to train offensive skills first.
